ooc: You got it.  Cyclonus better be ready, Tucson isn't one to give up too=
 quickly.  

BIC:

The drive to succeed, it was now surging rapidly through=
 Tucson's pistons and fuel injectors. He wasn't about to let a little pot h=
ole get in the way of him reaching his leader who he now believed was POW a=
nd held under demonic control. Reaching speeds of well over one twenty MPH =
he kicks up dust beneath his tires and handles the roughness of the terrain=
 as if it were as smooth as newly laid down asphault.  His sonar systems no=
w pick up the density and size of the dark tower which drives him forward, =
not to mention the fact that he could pick up heat signatures which resembl=
ed his own.  He knew.  Rodimus was there, and no doubt he'd be there with s=
ome familliar enemies.  The thought of Decepticons being involved in this e=
nrages him even more.

He thinks things through while driving toward the to=
wer, where he could sense Rodimus's heat signatures.

" How could I have le=
t this happen?  If I hadn't let my guard down the first time, and gotten my=
self shot, you wouldn't be in this mess Rodimus.  I promise you this though=
, this time, I will bring you back, and I will not abandon you.  No matter =
how hateful you are of me, no matter how badly you want to destroy me.  My =
spark is dedicated to those I care deeply for.  That part of me will never =
die.  I will also make those who are responsible for what they have done to=
 you, pay for what they did.  They had no right taking your spark and your =
soul.  I swear by the name of Primus that I will risk my own spark to see y=
ours safely out of harm's way."

He was now nearing the tower.  Another fam=
illiar signature pings loudly in his sonar system.  He could tell by the fr=
equency that it was from a Decepticon.  He could also identify the carrier.=


"Cyclonus...  Ohh yeah, this definitely has your name writen all over it.=
  Right, well, enjoy the party while it lasts because I'm about to crash it=
... Literally."

He senses he's only a few feet from the tower, and transfo=
rms.  Yet, he keeps hidden.  He knew that an all out attack wasn't the best=
 way to go.  If he was going to succeed in this mission, he'd have to do it=
 without being seen and right underneath Cyclonus's nose.  He was good at s=
taying out of the sight of the enemy.  Not only had he trained with Kup, bu=
t also trained with Prowl.  Silence was his middle name.  He sends a low po=
wered sonar wave to see if it picks up anything.  In the general area he wa=
s clear of incombants.  He knew that if he touched the tower there could be=
 an alarm system.  He scans for that.

"Hmm... Just in case, I should activ=
ate a scrambling wave.  That should quiet any security system that could be=
 active here..  I hope."

He waits a good five minuts or so until he's sure=
 that the system is disabled.  Once he runs a scan of his sonar systems, he=
 concludes that it did indeed have a mild effect on the system, which made =
it safe for him to approach the tower.  He again hides behind a mass of deb=
ris, and finds that breeze catches his face, from the opposite side of the =
tower. There was a door that was partially opened.  He feels for it with hi=
s fingers, and quietly slides it open just enough to sqeeze in, which was a=
 little bit of a squeeze for him.  This was it, he was inside.  Again, not =
wanting to make it obvious, he quietly slides the door just a bit ajar, to =
make sure he isn't discovered.  Then, quietly he hides again, and stops to =
try to pick up Rodimus's heat signature once more.  It was difficult, becau=
se his temperature continued to drop with every ounce of energy that was be=
ing stolen from him.  

" All right, low heat signature, this is going to m=
ake it a little difficult to track.  Time to boost up my receptors a bit...=
 And it wouldn't hurt to scramble my signals either..."  

Tucson had never=
 known fear and apprehension.  With every slow step, he becomes more and mo=
re familliar with both emotions.  He couldn't let them stop him.  He was do=
ing this to save Rodimus, a gesture from the spark who's power is relentles=
s.  His affections for his leader keeps him focused on the task at hand.  A=
nd it isn't long until his persistance pays off.  The ping was loud and cle=
ar, and yes, it was Rodimus.  The signature read Decepticon though.  But kn=
owing what Kenzo had told him, he keeps reserved.  Now, he wanted to be see=
n and heard.  With his cross bow subspaced he stands idol, but ready for an=
ything.  And quietly with a soft tone of voice..

"Rodimus."

>=
 >>> From what Kenzo had told him, Tucson could now put two and two togethe=
r and now realized that his restoration abilities along with his skills as =
a warrior, would be needed more than ever. To him Restoration was more than=
 just restoring artifacts, making them appear and work like new, it was als=
o about restoring old programming and recovery of important data. He did no=
t know the extent of the corruption upon which was placed on Rodimus but he=
 knew he couldn't just throw in the towel on his leader. Autobots stuck tog=
ether, and through thick and thin, he'd keep his pledge to never abandon hi=
s fellow Autobots. He also realized that if he was going to get anywhere, h=
e'd have to do it himself. 
> >>> 
> >>> "On second thought, I think I'll g=
o this one alone. Don't wait up for me, I don't think I'll be back too soon=
."
> >>> 
> >>> He bids Kenzo good bye and walks out of the room. 
> >>> 
>=
 >>> "Oh before I forget, have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. He'll n=
eed it more than me." 
> >>> 
> >>> He was dead set on recovering his leade=
r. And this time, nothing and no one would get in his way of achieving his =
mission. He sends one final message to Lord Perseus.
> >>> 
> >>> "Lord Per=
seus, it's come to my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has been abd=
ucted and altered severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a grave R=
isk, but most of all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to waste f=
or evil purposes. I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corruptive s=
tate. I hereby announce that I am on route to locating my leader, and I DO =
intend to BRING HIM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If not, th=
ere is question of the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, perhaps=
 not for my own personal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It's to=
o precious to lose to the hands of those who thirst for power and greed. I =
swear by Primus's name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast one.=
 May Primus guide you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I will =
report to you again, once I know more of the condition of my leader."
> >>>=
 
> >>> He signs off, gets off the ship, and transforms into SUV mode, hopi=
ng to find Rodimus via his sonar systems.

clonus.
